alert.note: Alert for Grays Harbor (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 11:12AM PST until January 11 at 12:26PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Chehalis River At Porter affecting Grays Harbor County. .The Chehalis River at Porter will continue to slowly recede today dropping below flood stage Tuesday. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Chehalis River At Porter. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 49.0 feet, the Chehalis River in Grays Harbor will flood pasture lands and many roads...including SR 12 between Oakville and Rochester. High tidal levels at Aberdeen will worsen flooding along the lower reaches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM PST Monday the stage was 49.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:45 AM PST Monday was 50.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tonight and will continue to recede. - Flood stage is 48.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 715 PM PST.
